metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2162 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Audit Plug-in). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.33 and prior and 8.0.23 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
